definition: to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own way, and shall be filled with their own devices.
sentences.chinese: 所以他们必要自食其果，饱尝独断独行的滋味。

sentences.english: They dare not break the herd, afraid of the ridicule of their neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他们怕邻居讥笑，不敢独断独行。

sentences.english: Nevertheless you are in a self-assertive mood today.
sentences.chinese: 今天你的情绪会比较独断独行。

sentences.english: You're a natural leader but often like to do things by yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你是一位天生的领导者，却喜欢独断独行。

definition: to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
to let emotions affect one's decisions
